page.title: 16EDUCATION IN THE AREA
page.content: Children commence school, very often part-time, at the beginning of the school year in which they become five. In this area the schools are in three tiers. The First School takes children up to nine years of age. Most of the children transfer at this age to the Oundle Middle School. There are Middle Schools for children in the Kings Cliffe and Thrapston catchment areas also. They remain at the Middle Schools for four years. Most then transfer to the Prince William School. This is an upper school with children from 13 to 18 years of age mainly from the Oundle, Kings Cliffe and Thrapston areas.
